entity.name: EnAccess Foundation
entity.description: EnAccess is a globally active NGO, registered in the Netherlands. We are dedicated to promote the usage and adoption of Open Source and Open Innovation in the Energy Access sector. And therewith progress on the path of achieving universal access to energy (SDG7).

projects.name: MicroPowerManager
projects.description: Open Source Management Tool for Decentralized Utilities

projects.name: Digitalization Support Hub
projects.description: An intuitive, user-friendly, interactive open-source map of digital tools for Distributed Renewable Energy (DRE) companies providing. It features a built-in "wizard" to assist businesses in selecting the most suitable tools for their needs. For context: The digitalization of DRE companies' activities is a precondition to their operational efficiency and scalability. Hence, it is required to achieve Sustainable Development Goal 7 (Universal access to reliable and affordable energy). Despite the widespread availability of digital tools, these technologies are underutilized in operations, management, remote monitoring, reporting, and verification (MRV), particularly in domestic and small DRE companies.

plans.name: MicroPowerManager: Hosting support
plans.description: Support the MicroPowerManager environment by covering monthly server costs.

plans.name: MicroPowerManager: Frontend Vue3 migration
plans.description: The MicroPowerManager currently runs on the (by now) deprecated Vue2 frontend. This task is to update the frontend framework and it's depdendencies to Vue3 to make the MicroPowerManager a future proof application.

plans.name: Digitalization Support Hub: Frontend engineering support
plans.description: For implementation and development of the mobile and desktop versions of the tools map and the wizard easing the interaction with our created database, we estimate the need for 3 month part-time from a mid-level frontend developer.

plans.name: Digitalization Support Hub: UX design for the tools map and wizard:
plans.description: This activity aims to create the basis for an interactive digital tools map with two navigation methods: (1) Project lifecycle category filtering & (2) Guided "wizard" with multiple-choice questions supporting users to identify suitable digital tools.

plans.name: Digitalization Support Hub: Build Integrations/connectors for up to 5 tools featured in the tools map for Energy Access tools
plans.description: For some of the tools featured and included in the tools map, we want to provide free connectors to other tools or systems used by the SMEs or possibilities to extract data; based on our current research, we estimate this will be required for approx. 5 tools.

plans.name: Digitalization Support Hub: Monthly checks of third-party links and references
plans.description: To ensure the smooth and up-to-date function of the tools map, we anticipate the need for at least one year before a large enough community has grown to regularly check, validate, and, if required, update links and other references on the tools featured. Also, user feedback shall be reviewed and, where appropriate, be converted into tickets/issues.
